column4: ok, so I installed Ubuntu 8.10 with Kernel 2.6.27, but it keeps telling me I have to update the kernel, even if I already have updated it (unnecessarily) 2 times. How can I solve this problem, please?
there is *another* kernel upgrade
but I have already updated it 2 times!
today ?
yesterday evening. Should I update it again?
open a terminal, and run: apt-cache policy linux-image-2.6.27-7-generic
but be warned that some people are having issues with the latest upgrade
oh, now I can see I do not have the latest one. But shouldn't this be shown in the update window? Anyways, do I update it even with the problem out there?
it's your choice, on my laptop sound is not working now :P
I see. What's your sound card, btw? Is it Intel?
yes
but my desktop is also intel hda, and is working fine, so it only affects a specific model
not good :x I better off wait for the next update, I suppose
I see. How can I check if mine is affected?
no idea :|
lspci | grep Audio
00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801G (ICH7 Family) High Definition Audio Controller (rev 02)
I am not on the affected system right now :\
what's yours?
I see
thank you anyway. :)
you are safe
yeah, I see! Great news! :D
